title: Build a Debris Hut Shelter
brief: Construct a highly effective insulated shelter using natural materials for maximum warmth retention.
steps: Step 1: Create a ridgepole by making a tripod with two short stakes and one long pole, or anchor one end to a tree at waist height.
Step 2: Prop large sticks along both sides of ridgepole to create wedge-shaped ribbing wide enough for your body.
Step 3: Ensure ribbing is steep enough to shed moisture effectively.
Step 4: Place finer sticks and brush crosswise on the ribbing to create latticework preventing debris from falling through.
Step 5: Add light, dry debris (grass, pine needles, leaves) over ribbing until at least 1 meter thick - thicker is better.
Step 6: Place 30-centimeter layer of insulating material inside the shelter for bedding.
Step 7: Pile insulating material at entrance that can be dragged inside to close the opening.
Step 8: Add shingling material or branches on top to prevent debris from blowing away in storms.
warnings: Debris layer must be at least 1 meter thick for adequate insulation.
Ensure ribbing is steep enough or shelter will not shed water properly.
Check overhead for loose branches or dead trees that could fall on shelter.
